lines.gurmukhi: bYsno AnMin bHmMin swlgRwm syvw gIqw Bwgvq sRoqw eykwkI khwveI
lines.transliteration_english: Baisano Ananni Brahamanni Saalagraam Sayvaa , Geetaa Bhaagavat Srotaa Aykaakee Kahaavaee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: If someone is a worshipper of Vishnu, is brahmin by caste, worships (stone) and listens to the recitation of Geeta and Bhagwat in a secluded place;

lines.gurmukhi: qIrQ Drm dyv jwqRw kau pMifq pUiC krq gvn su mhUrq soDwveI
lines.transliteration_english: Teerad Dharam Dayv Jaatraa Kau Pandit Poochhi , Karat Gavan Su Mahoorat Sodhaavaee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Have the auspicious time and date worked out by learned brahmins before proceeding on religious places or visiting the temples of gods and goddesses located on banks of rivers;

lines.gurmukhi: bwhir inkis grDb s√çwn sgnu kY sMkw auprwij bhuir Gir AwvhI
lines.transliteration_english: Baahari Nikasi Garadhab Svaan Saganu Kai , Sankaa Ouparaaji Bahuri Ghari Aavahee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: But when he sets out of the house and faces a dog or a donkey, he regards it inauspicious and a doubt arises in his mind forcing him to return home.

lines.gurmukhi: piqbRq gih rih skq n eykw tyk dubDw AiCq n prMm pdu pwvhI ]447]
lines.transliteration_english: Patibrat Gahi Rahi Sakat N Aykaa Tayka , Doubadhaa Achhit N Paranm Padu Paavahee ?447?

Shabad OS B.translation: Despite belonging to a Guru like a faithful wife, if a person does not acknowledge the support of his Guru firmly and wanders at the door of one god or the other, he cannot reach the supreme state of Oneness with God having been caught in duality.  (447)
